channel.title: Java problem with Web Client
channel.description:
When i open my site, there is a large white box where the client is supposed to be, with Error in it. Here is the error i get:
[code]java.lang.ClassFormatError: Incompatible magic value 1008813135 in class file client at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadCode(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager.createApplet(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager$AppletExecutionRunnable.run(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Exception: java.lang.ClassFormatError: Incompatible magic value 1008813135 in class file client[/code]
Anyone know how to fix this? I used Ric's web client TuT.
Thanks, Dapk1nmasta

item.title: Java problem with Web Client
item.dc:creator: @dapk1nmasta dapk1nmasta
item.description:
@dapk1nmasta wrote:

When i open my site, there is a large white box where the client is supposed to be, with Error in it. Here is the error i get:

java.lang.ClassFormatError: Incompatible magic value 1008813135 in class file client at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadCode(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager.createApplet(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager$AppletExecutionRunnable.run(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Exception: java.lang.ClassFormatError: Incompatible magic value 1008813135 in class file client

Anyone know how to fix this? I used Ricâ€™s web client TuT.

Thanks,
Dapk1nmasta
